VahidsKneadedOnigiri.name: Vahid's Kneaded Onigiri
VahidsKneadedOnigiri.description: Onigiri made from rice cultivated personally by Vahid. It tastes as good as it looks.

NaganoharaFireworksNote.name: Naganohara Fireworks Note
NaganoharaFireworksNote.description: A note that Yoimiya gave you to record firework formulae with. If you give this note to Yoimiya, she will be able to make fireworks just as you remember them.\nNo matter how time passes, or people and things change, so long as you take care of this note, you will stand guard over a door to the past. Perhaps you too will find happiness that belongs only to you under a firework-filled sky.

SpiritPearl.name: Spirit Pearl
SpiritPearl.description: An ancient, vibrant pearl, within which lies the secret of the ocean depths.

KeyOfTheMoonBathedDeep.name: Key of the Moon-Bathed Deep
KeyOfTheMoonBathedDeep.description: A strange treasure with an awkward name. It is said to have been forged from the blood of Watatsumi Omikami.

StrangeBottle.name: Strange Bottle
StrangeBottle.description: A vessel with an odd appearance. It seems fragile, but is actually quite sturdy.

WaterWellingWithWishes.name: Water Welling With "Wishes"
WaterWellingWithWishes.description: This water is filled with hopes and dreams. Please send them to the place where they belong.

SpiritherbWater.name: Spiritherb Water
SpiritherbWater.description: Crystal-clear water, the ideal source of hydration for the Spiritherb.

RinzousLetter.name: Rinzou's Letter
RinzousLetter.description: A letter written by the legendary pirate Rinzou. The paper is all crumpled up. It must have been wet at some point.

RinzousSignet.name: Rinzou's Signet
RinzousSignet.description: A signet left behind by the great pirate Rinzou as proof of a glorious life of adventure.

HiddenLedger.name: Hidden Ledger
HiddenLedger.description: A ledger that seems to contain the recent taxation situations of Ritou's merchants. Its owner is Keijirou.

KomoreTeahouseInvitationLetter.name: Komore Teahouse Invitation Letter
KomoreTeahouseInvitationLetter.description: Whomsoever has this invitation letter may enter Komore Teahouse. It has the seal of the Yashiro Commission on it.

ALoveLetter.name: A Love Letter(?)
ALoveLetter.description: A letter that Hiiragi Chisato has written for Kujou Kamaji. She would be mad if you opened it up without her permission...

CookedMeat.name: Cooked Meat
CookedMeat.description: Meat that has just been cooked. Maybe it can be used in a dish...

TheSeventhSamuraiScript.name: "The Seventh Samurai" Script
TheSeventhSamuraiScript.description: A "film script" you obtained from Xavier.

ANoteLeftBySomeone.name: A Note Left by Someone
ANoteLeftBySomeone.description: A special fortune slip that a certain person left behind. A certain location is recorded within. This may have something to do with Gendou Ringo's disappearance.

LightlyPerfumedLetter.name: Lightly-Perfumed Letter
LightlyPerfumedLetter.description: You obtained this from an infantryman at the Kanjou Commission. They say that this was written personally by the young lady of the Hiiragi Clan.

TravelPermit.name: Travel Permit
TravelPermit.description: A special Travel Permit that allows travel throughout Inazuma. With this in hand, you can now freely enter and leave Ritou...

KujouKamajisLetter.name: Kujou Kamaji's Letter
KujouKamajisLetter.description: Kujou Kamaji asked you to carry this letter that he personally penned to Hiiragi Chisato. According to him, this one was the best-worded of the lot.

SnackBox.name: Snack Box
SnackBox.description: A box of snacks that Kujou Kamaji request you bring to Hiiragi Chisato. It seems very full indeed...

DullGoldenBridle.name: Dull Golden Bridle
DullGoldenBridle.description: The hereditary national treasure of Byakuyakoku, but it has lost all of its own power. This was done to prevent thieves who have entered through alternative means from seeing its value.

GoldenBridle.name: Golden Bridle
GoldenBridle.description: The hereditary national treasure of Byakuyakoku. It represents the highest authority in the land and confers the power to control Evernight and Whitenight upon its wielder.

ReinsOfRevivalFragmentTheNarrows.name: Reins of Revival Fragment (The Narrows)
ReinsOfRevivalFragmentTheNarrows.description: A fragment of the Reins of Revival. It is made from a special material.

ReinsOfRevivalFragmentTemple.name: Reins of Revival Fragment (Temple)
ReinsOfRevivalFragmentTemple.description: A fragment of the Reins of Revival. It has some special power.

ReinsOfRevivalFragmentSerpentsHeart.name: Reins of Revival Fragment (Serpent's Heart)
ReinsOfRevivalFragmentSerpentsHeart.description: A fragment of the Reins of Revival. The three fragments, too, follow "The Rule of Three."

ReinsOfRevival.name: Reins of Revival
ReinsOfRevival.description: The hereditary national treasure of Byakuyakoku. Apart from representing the highest authority in the land, it also confers the ability to control souls and this realm.

OfferingsOfTheNarrows.name: Offerings of The Narrows
OfferingsOfTheNarrows.description: Offerings from The Narrows that contain a fraction of Aberaku's remnant thoughts.

OfferingsOfTheTemple.name: Offerings of the Temple
OfferingsOfTheTemple.description: Offerings from the Evernight Temple that contain a fraction of Aberaku's remnant thoughts.

OfferingsOfTheSerpentsHeart.name: Offerings of the Serpent's Heart
OfferingsOfTheSerpentsHeart.description: Offerings from the Serpent's Heart that contain a fraction of Aberaku's remnant thoughts.

TheSerpentAndDrakesOfTokoyokoku.name: The Serpent and Drakes of Tokoyokoku
TheSerpentAndDrakesOfTokoyokoku.description: A novel based on Watatsumi Island's folktales. The original edition of this text was transcribed on Watatsumi Island and brought back to Narukami Island by a merchant while the former's serpent god yet lived. No one reads this ancient tome nowadays, its role supplanted by all the light novels on the market. This book describes the unique cosmological outlook of the Watatsumi people before they came to adopt aspects of Narukami culture, and a recent resurgence in traditional novel publishing has allowed it to see the light of day once more.

BathysmalVishapExperimentalRecords.name: Bathysmal Vishap Experimental Records
BathysmalVishapExperimentalRecords.description: Experimental Records of the Bathysmal Vishaps. No vishaps were killed in the writing of these records.

BeforeSunAndMoon.name: Before Sun and Moon
BeforeSunAndMoon.description: A chronicle that ordinary folk have been forbidden to read. The writing is a mix of fables and histories from the beginning of the world to the creation of the Dainichi Mikoshi.

HydrologicalStudiesInByakuyakoku.name: Hydrological Studies in Byakuyakoku
HydrologicalStudiesInByakuyakoku.description: This text records the geography and hydrology of Byakuyakoku. With the sealing of the depths and the emigration of the people of Watatsumi, as well as the passing of long years, this book is now useless.

InTheLightBeneathTheShadow.name: In the Light, Beneath the Shadow
InTheLightBeneathTheShadow.description: A puzzle book for children of ages nine to twelve. As a book from a transitory period, it uses Narukami-style names with Byakuyakoku subscripts.

KeySigil.name: Key Sigil
KeySigil.description: A sigil passed down through Watatsumi Island and Enkanomiya. Such pictures are used in unlocking, and are thus named "Key Sigils."

BloodbranchCoral.name: Bloodbranch Coral
BloodbranchCoral.description: A coral in which the life force of Watatsumi Omikami dwells. It is a vital part of the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri.

DivineBridle.name: Divine Bridle
DivineBridle.description: A symbol of the Sunchild's authority, made in the shape of a bridle. It does not possess any special power by itself.

DatesMedalOfRecognition.name: Date's Medal of Recognition
DatesMedalOfRecognition.description: A medal that represents Date's recognition. It is very well-made.

SecretRoomKey.name: Secret Room Key
SecretRoomKey.description: A key that opens the door to a certain secret room in The Narrows. This might be one of the abandoned safehouses that Adonis and his compatriots once used.

WatersOfLethe.name: Waters of Lethe
WatersOfLethe.description: Water from a river that flows near the Evernight Temple. It shines with a faint light in the darkness. Directly ingesting this liquid will not cause you to forget anything, but the Dragonbone Orb created through its auspices has this effect.

DragonboneOrb.name: Dragonbone Orb
DragonboneOrb.description: The fruit of the Dragonbone Flower, created via the use of the Waters of Lethe. It is said to sweep one's worries away and bring peace. Giving up your objectives, forsaking desire, and becoming content and satisfied... Is that not happiness?

KeyToSomePlace.name: Key to Some Place
KeyToSomePlace.description: A key found in Tatarasuna.\nWhere there's a key, there's got to be a lock to match.

SunDriedSweetFlower.name: Sun-Dried Sweet Flower
SunDriedSweetFlower.description: A dried flower from Hanayama Kaoru. It was the first flower to grow in that brand-new floral sea.

PeculiarPinion.name: Peculiar Pinion
PeculiarPinion.description: A strange feather you discovered after defeating the monster on the summit of Amakumo Peak.

Maushiro.name: Maushiro
Maushiro.description: An item that Sumida tasked you to find.\nYou found this Maushiro on Tsurumi Island, and it seems to be a traditional instrument around these parts.\nThat said, it should have been at least a few thousand years since Tsurumi Island last played host to any civilization at all.

AnOnikabutoAffectedByTatarigami.name: An Onikabuto Affected by Tatarigami
AnOnikabutoAffectedByTatarigami.description: An onikabuto that has fallen under the influence of Tatarigami. Who knows what sort of tests Xavier wants to put it through...

MissingComponents.name: Missing Component(s)
MissingComponents.description: A component that fell from the Purification Device.

FuneraryMask.name: Funerary Mask
FuneraryMask.description:
A trophy obtained from defeating Signora, Eighth of the Fatui Harbingers.
The Fatui often face the world from behind their masks, and it is said that this is because all they once were mean nothing once they become Fatui, and thus must they forsake their true names and faces alike.

—Yet the act of giving up all that makes up an "I" — one's past and the bonds that come with it — is no mean feat.
Perhaps it is fair to say that only those who possess an obsession close to or even exceeding the level of delusion might be willing to join this group that so rebels against the Heavenly Principles, binding their remaining days to their Delusions and burning as brightly as stars.
...Of course, many within the Fatui are simply consumed by power and are simple sadists — nor are these states necessarily in conflict.

The woman whose real name was Rosalyne-Kruzchka Lohefalter may have once led a more innocent, naive existence.
But that was before her eyes were filled with a raging fire, and her innocent days were burned away. Before the icy Delusion extinguished the flaming tongues that ever gnawed her. Before the frozen might that protected her was shattered by the eternal outlander, unbound yet no less determined than she was, causing the flames to burst forth once more...

MusoujinGorgeRockPillarPearl.name: Musoujin Gorge: Rock Pillar Pearl
MusoujinGorgeRockPillarPearl.description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

MusoujinGorgeRockPillarWardingStone.name: Musoujin Gorge: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
MusoujinGorgeRockPillarWardingStone.description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

SerpentsHeadRockPillarPearl.name: Serpent's Head: Rock Pillar Pearl
SerpentsHeadRockPillarPearl.description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

SerpentsHeadRockPillarWardingStone.name: Serpent's Head: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
SerpentsHeadRockPillarWardingStone.description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

JakotsuMineRockPillarPearl.name: Jakotsu Mine: Rock Pillar Pearl
JakotsuMineRockPillarPearl.description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

JakotsuMineRockPillarWardingStone.name: Jakotsu Mine: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
JakotsuMineRockPillarWardingStone.description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

FortMumeiRockPillarPearl.name: Fort Mumei: Rock Pillar Pearl
FortMumeiRockPillarPearl.description: A precious pearl that emits Electro energy and a strangely-colored light. It seems to have some connection with the rock pillars on the island.

FortMumeiRockPillarWardingStone.name: Fort Mumei: Rock Pillar Warding Stone
FortMumeiRockPillarWardingStone.description: A gem that has an electric scent and that is quite shocking to the touch. It has some unknown connection to the rock pillars on the island.

NakuWeedSeed.name: Naku Weed Seed
NakuWeedSeed.description: A bag of Naku Weed seeds.

PipingHotBraisedMeat.name: Piping-Hot Braised Meat
PipingHotBraisedMeat.description: Braised Meat made using the Supreme Cuisine Machine. Fresh and steaming hot.

FamilyLetter.name: Family Letter
FamilyLetter.description: The page has already yellowed and become incredibly brittle. A single touch might break it.

TatteredLetter.name: Tattered Letter
TatteredLetter.description: Someone's private thoughts are written in this tattered letter. Unfortunately, the years have eaten away at the words that were penned until they became blurred, and if not for someone having dug it up, these past events may have forever slept under the soil.

PharmacistsNotebookI.name: Pharmacist's Notebook (I)
PharmacistsNotebookI.description: Notes left by Yasumoto. They still smell strongly of Naku Weed.

PharmacistsNotebookII.name: Pharmacist's Notebook (II)
PharmacistsNotebookII.description: Notes left by Yasumoto. It has been conscientiously protected from rain damage.

PharmacistsNotebookIII.name: Pharmacist's Notebook (III)
PharmacistsNotebookIII.description: Notes left by Yasumoto. It shows some signs of blotching and water damage.

UnsealedLetter.name: Unsealed Letter
UnsealedLetter.description: A letter that seems brand new but that has already been opened. It gives off a light sakura scent.

InabaTousaburouKyuuzousFinalWords.name: Inaba Tousaburou Kyuuzou's Final Words
InabaTousaburouKyuuzousFinalWords.description: A letter filled with words from margin to margin. Its author has gone missing.

StarShapedGem.name: Star-Shaped Gem
StarShapedGem.description: A mysterious gem of unknown make. It shines like a star even when placed inside your backpack.\nPerhaps this is the key to completing a certain "image."

StoneSlate.name: Stone Slate
StoneSlate.description: A stone slate with Ishine Script carved into it.\nPerhaps it may be of some use on Tsurumi Island...?

KamuijimaCannonMap.name: Kamuijima Cannon Map
KamuijimaCannonMap.description: A map that records the positions of the Kamuijima Cannons.

HighQualityRice.name: High-Quality Rice
HighQualityRice.description: High-quality rice that you obtained from Brunn. It looks like it'll cook well.

FragrantRicePudding.name: Fragrant Rice Pudding
FragrantRicePudding.description: Rice Pudding made using the Supreme Cuisine Machine. One wonders how it might taste...

AnemoSlimeSwallowedBambooShoots.name: Anemo Slime-Swallowed Bamboo Shoots
AnemoSlimeSwallowedBambooShoots.description: Bamboo Shoots that have been swallowed by Anemo Slimes. Who knows what special flavor they might add...

PipingHotOncidiumTofu.name: Piping-Hot Oncidium Tofu
PipingHotOncidiumTofu.description: Oncidium Tofu made using the Supreme Cuisine Machine. One wonders what flavors this is going to have...

FossilBag.name: Fossil Bag
FossilBag.description: A bag containing the suspected fossil of the Lunar Leviathan. Give it to Kujirai Momiji... though one wonders if she can accept this reality.

TreasuryKey.name: "Treasury" Key
TreasuryKey.description: A key treasured by the bandits. This must be one of the keys to finding the secret treasure... right?

IncompleteNotes.name: Incomplete Notes
IncompleteNotes.description: A tattered page. For some reason, it gives off the stench of stale grain.

TatteredPaper.name: Tattered Paper
TatteredPaper.description: A crumpled note very messy, illegible handwriting.

PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIsland.name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island
PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIsland.description: A picture of some place on Seirai Island. Who knows why it would be buried here...

PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIslandII.name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island (II)
PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIslandII.description: A picture you got from Mr. Oda Tarou, it seems to show some place on Seirai Island...

PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIslandIII.name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island (III)
PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIslandIII.description: A picture you got from Mr. Oda Tarou, it seems to show some place on Seirai Island...

PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIslandIV.name: Picture Commemorating Seirai Island (IV)
PictureCommemoratingSeiraiIslandIV.description: A picture you got from Mr. Oda Tarou, it seems to show some place on Seirai Island...

FujiwaraToshikosTreasureMap.name: Fujiwara Toshiko's Treasure Map
FujiwaraToshikosTreasureMap.description: A treasure map you obtained from Fujiwara Toshiko. According to her, this map hides the means by which certain mechanisms may be activated.

ABagOfBeans.name: A Bag of Beans
ABagOfBeans.description: Beans you got from Sango. Arataki Itto seems to be allergic to beans, so these may prove to be useful tools in stopping him from resisting too much.\nSango says they're not free, though. Hopefully they don't cost too much...

RightSidePhoto.name: Right-Side Photo
RightSidePhoto.description: A picture of Neko, taken from the right.

LeftSidePhoto.name: Left-Side Photo
LeftSidePhoto.description: A picture of Neko, taken from the left.

InferiorStarsilver.name: Inferior Starsilver
InferiorStarsilver.description: Starsilver with low luster and dull coloration. It will most likely not sell for a high price.

QualityStarsilver.name: Quality Starsilver
QualityStarsilver.description: Starsilver with great luster and a lovely coloration.

Key.name: Key
Key.description: A unique-looking key. You can open the cage holding Bennett with it.

BoxOfClothes.name: Box of Clothes
BoxOfClothes.description: This box contains the clothes that Ningguang asked you to go get. As she said, "I need a change of mood, and a change of clothes will facilitate that."

IronChunk.name: Iron Chunk
IronChunk.description: This iron chunk can be turned into a multitude of handy items in the hands of a skilled craftsman.

WhiteIronChunk.name: White Iron Chunk
WhiteIronChunk.description: Skilled hands can make this into something brilliant.

CrystalChunk.name: Crystal Chunk
CrystalChunk.description: An uncut crystal. Only professional craftsmanship can bring out its true value.

MagicalCrystalChunk.name: Magical Crystal Chunk
MagicalCrystalChunk.description: These crystal chunks can be refined into Weapon EXP materials by using Original Resin.\nCrystals from mines that were eroded by the energy of the Ley Lines cannot be processed by ordinary means.

Starsilver.name: Starsilver
Starsilver.description: A rare and precious ore formed by the unique geographical conditions and Ley Lines of Dragonspine.

AmethystLump.name: Amethyst Lump
AmethystLump.description: An uncut crystal that can only be found in Inazuma. Some professional craftsmanship will bring out its true value.

NorthlanderSwordBillet.name: Northlander Sword Billet
NorthlanderSwordBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords. \nPhilosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

NorthlanderBowBillet.name: Northlander Bow Billet
NorthlanderBowBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows. \nPhilosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

NorthlanderClaymoreBillet.name: Northlander Claymore Billet
NorthlanderClaymoreBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores. \nPhilosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

NorthlanderCatalystBillet.name: Northlander Catalyst Billet
NorthlanderCatalystBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts. \nPhilosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

NorthlanderPolearmBillet.name: Northlander Polearm Billet
NorthlanderPolearmBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms. \nPhilosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

NorthlanderSword.name: Northlander Sword
NorthlanderSword.description: An unknown sword from the Northlands

NorthlanderBow.name: Northlander Bow
NorthlanderBow.description: An unknown bow from the Northlands

NorthlanderClaymore.name: Northlander Claymore
NorthlanderClaymore.description: An unknown claymore from the Northlands

NorthlanderCatalyst.name: Northlander Catalyst
NorthlanderCatalyst.description: An unknown catalyst from the Northlands

MidlanderSwordBillet.name: Midlander Sword Billet
MidlanderSwordBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords.\nPhilosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

MidlanderBowBillet.name: Midlander Bow Billet
MidlanderBowBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows.\nPhilosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

MidlanderClaymoreBillet.name: Midlander Claymore Billet
MidlanderClaymoreBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.\nPhilosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

MidlanderCatalystBillet.name: Midlander Catalyst Billet
MidlanderCatalystBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts.\nPhilosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

MidlanderPolearmBillet.name: Midlander Polearm Billet
MidlanderPolearmBillet.description: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.\nPhilosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

Onikabuto.name: Onikabuto
Onikabuto.description: A strange beetle that inhabits areas rich with Electro energy. Its docile and sedentary temperament could not be more different from the fierce, demonic visage displayed on its armored shell.

SakuraBloom.name: Sakura Bloom
SakuraBloom.description: Blossoms from the Sacred Sakura at the Grand Narukami Shrine, filled with a fondness for Inazuma.

CrystalMarrow.name: Crystal Marrow
CrystalMarrow.description: A crystal that contains a sliver of Tatarigami power. Adding this material during smelting will greatly increase the strength and toughness of metals.

Dendrobium.name: Dendrobium
Dendrobium.description: A vibrant plant that has also been named the "lycoris" by the poets. It was once thought extinct in the Inazuman archipelago, only to re-emerge now upon the battlefields. It is said that it blooms most enchantingly where much blood was spilled.

NakuWeed.name: Naku Weed
NakuWeed.description: Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The parts of it that resemble petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.

SeaGanoderma.name: Sea Ganoderma
SeaGanoderma.description: A plant species that only grows in certain regions and islands of the ocean. Though it looks like a fungus of some sort, it actually comes from a substance secreted by certain soft-bodied organisms.

SangoPearl.name: Sango Pearl
SangoPearl.description: A precious pearl that grows in the coral of Watatsumi. Gives off a cool sheen like that of the moonlight.

AmakumoFruit.name: Amakumo Fruit
AmakumoFruit.description: The fruit of the Amakumo Grass, which grows on Seirai Island. You can hear it crackling with a tiny current if you hold it up to your ear.

FluorescentFungus.name: Fluorescent Fungus
FluorescentFungus.description: A mushroom that glows like a night-light. Some curious power lies hidden within it.

Seagrass.name: Seagrass
Seagrass.description: A plant that grows in shallow seas. It adds a unique flavor to dishes.

LavenderMelon.name: Lavender Melon
LavenderMelon.description: A brightly-colored fruit. The flesh within transforms into food with a unique mouthfeel when cooked.

Starshroom.name: Starshroom
Starshroom.description: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It is quite hardy indeed. Once it matures, the center of the cap will split open.

RukkhashavaMushrooms.name: Rukkhashava Mushrooms
RukkhashavaMushrooms.description: A fungus that grows in layers upon layers, like a sea of clouds, and which mostly grows on trees deep in the rainforest. Therefore, they are considered by the people of Sumeru to be the holy crystallization of Rukkhadevata's legacy.

Padisarah.name: Padisarah
Padisarah.description: A holy and noble plant. The conditions for growth in its environment are very demanding. The flower buds can be processed to make valuable spices.

NilotpalaLotus.name: Nilotpala Lotus
NilotpalaLotus.description: Growing in the forest wetlands, these plants only bloom at night with flowers as bright as the moon.

HarraFruit.name: Harra Fruit
HarraFruit.description: Growing in the hot humid rainforest, it is a fruit with a special spicy aroma. When ground to powder, spices can be made from it. It is the most valued spice plant in Sumeru.

KalpalataLotus.name: Kalpalata Lotus
KalpalataLotus.description: Flowers from vines that grow on cliff sides. It is called a lotus only because it has a similar appearance to one. Aside from that, it bears no other similar properties to the lotus.

ZaytunPeach.name: Zaytun Peach
ZaytunPeach.description: The fruit of a forest shrub. Its flesh is firm and sweet. It is said to have a calming effect on the mind.

SumeruRose.name: Sumeru Rose
SumeruRose.description: Bright and beautiful, these pure purple flowers give off a pleasant fragrance that will give any passerby pause. While some like to call this a type of "rambler rose," its relative lack of multiple flowers means that it falls under a different floral classification.

Redcrest.name: Redcrest
Redcrest.description: A fruit that grows even in the most hostile of desert environments. Its vibrant crimson fruits are made even more lovely against a backdrop of yellow sand.

AjilenakhNut.name: Ajilenakh Nut
AjilenakhNut.description: A fruit that grows on evergreen trees within desert oases. The flesh under the tough skin is thick, sweet, and delicious, making it an important food source amongst the desert peoples.

Scarab.name: Scarab
Scarab.description: A tenacious beetle that finds repose within the vast ocean of desert sand. The golden pattern on such beetles' shells hints at some deep relationship between them and the ancient ruins that dot the desert.

ActivatedStarshroom.name: Activated Starshroom
ActivatedStarshroom.description: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be bursting with vitality.

ScorchedStarshroom.name: Scorched Starshroom
ScorchedStarshroom.description: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be a little singed.

Viparyas.name: Viparyas
Viparyas.description: A flower without seeds. \nOnce the earth remembers, the Viparyas will bloom.

BirchWood.name: Birch Wood
BirchWood.description: Timber obtained from birches. It is easy to work with and produces smooth cuts. Furniture made using such wood is both beautiful and durable.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

CuihuaWood.name: Cuihua Wood
CuihuaWood.description: Timber obtained from Cuihua Trees. With its lovely color and unique make, it will surely be able to take on myriad uses upon undergoing suitable workmanship.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

PineWood.name: Pine Wood
PineWood.description: Timber obtained from pines. Its color and grain are nothing to write home about, but its unpretentious nature is elegant in its own right. The wood is very sturdy as well. In able hands, its products should be able to resist moth and rot alike.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

SandbearerWood.name: Sandbearer Wood
SandbearerWood.description: Timber from the Sandbearer Tree. Said to be an exceptionally hardy plant resistant to wind and rain with a long lifespan.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

BambooSegment.name: Bamboo Segment
BambooSegment.description: Segments of bamboo that are light and far stronger than their humble appearance might suggest. It lets off a light fragrance.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

FragrantCedarWood.name: Fragrant Cedar Wood
FragrantCedarWood.description: Wood from the Cedar tree. Also known as the "Fragrant Cedar" for the aromatic oils it contains.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

FirWood.name: Fir Wood
FirWood.description: Wood from the tree known as "Faber's Fir." Widely used for its fine quality and attractive grain.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

YumemiruWood.name: Yumemiru Wood
YumemiruWood.description: Timber obtained from Sakura Trees. Exquisite in quality and full of moisture, people say that it can lull people into dreams as sweet as the warm spring.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

MapleWood.name: Maple Wood
MapleWood.description: Timber from the Amur Maple. Excellent quality wood with a fine color and texture.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

AraliaWood.name: Aralia Wood
AraliaWood.description: Wood from the Inazuman Cedar. It is soft, has straight veins, and gives off a light fragrance.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

OtogiWood.name: Otogi Wood
OtogiWood.description: Wood from the Otogi Tree. It has just the right amount of moisture and oil, and as such has a great many uses.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

Brightwood.name: Brightwood
Brightwood.description: Timber from the Brightwood Tree. It seems to have different properties from ordinary wood — soft but extremely resilient, easy to dye, and can be used for special purposes. \nCan be used to create furnishings.

KarmaphalaWood.name: Karmaphala Wood
KarmaphalaWood.description: The wood of the Karmaphala Tree. One can easily get a nice, smooth surface while working on this material and obtain a rather eye-pleasing result without going through any sophisticated processes.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

AdhigamaWood.name: Adhigama Wood
AdhigamaWood.description: The wood of the Adhigama Tree. Can be found everywhere and therefore appears rather ordinary, but the wood is durable and easy to handle.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

MountainDateWood.name: Mountain Date Wood
MountainDateWood.description: Wood of the Mountain Date Tree. Although it neither feels special to touch nor possesses a special texture, it retains water exceedingly well and is thus easy to grow.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

AthelWood.name: Athel Wood
AthelWood.description: Wood of the Athel Tree. It has a special texture and is resilient to both drought and humidity, making it very durable.\nCan be used to create furnishings.

Fabric.name: Fabric
Fabric.description: Some fabric of fine make. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.

RedDye.name: Red Dye
RedDye.description: Red dye. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.

YellowDye.name: Yellow Dye
YellowDye.description: Yellow dye. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.

BlueDye.name: Blue Dye
BlueDye.description: Blue dye. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.

TornPageTokiAlleyTalesPrologue.name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (Prologue)
TornPageTokiAlleyTalesPrologue.description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (Prologue).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

TornPageTokiAlleyTalesI.name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (I)
TornPageTokiAlleyTalesI.description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (I).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

TornPageTokiAlleyTalesII.name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (II)
TornPageTokiAlleyTalesII.description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (II).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

TornPageTokiAlleyTalesIII.name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (III)
TornPageTokiAlleyTalesIII.description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (III).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

TornPageTokiAlleyTalesIV.name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (IV)
TornPageTokiAlleyTalesIV.description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (IV).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

TornPageTokiAlleyTalesV.name: Torn Page: Toki Alley Tales (V)
TornPageTokiAlleyTalesV.description:
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (V).

This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

TokiAlleyTalesPrologue.name: Toki Alley Tales (Prologue)
TokiAlleyTalesPrologue.description: They say that in the past, when the fragile and short-lived mortals had yet to cross over the sea unto these lands, Inazuma was once a land that belonged to the tanuki. They say, too, that human history began as drunken tanuki nonsense... Welcome to Toki Alley, a place where history and wild tales intertwine.

TokiAlleyTalesI.name: Toki Alley Tales (I)
TokiAlleyTalesI.description: The great tengu are naught but brutal braggarts, and especially when drunk! — Tanuki Historical Commentary

TokiAlleyTalesII.name: Toki Alley Tales (II)
TokiAlleyTalesII.description: Mother once warned that a beautiful face can hide deceptive intentions. If she looks as lovely as the moonlight, she must either be a fox spirit, or some old bake-neko hag of significant power — Tanuki Historical Commentary

TokiAlleyTalesIII.name: Toki Alley Tales (III)
TokiAlleyTalesIII.description: They say that those who make the ameonna cry will bring inescapable sorrow upon themselves. —Tanuki Historical Commentary

TokiAlleyTalesIV.name: Toki Alley Tales (IV)
TokiAlleyTalesIV.description: The tragedy of mortals is to lack self-knowledge, and that of the youkai is the lack of any such tragic troubles. —Tanuki Historical Commentary

TokiAlleyTalesV.name: Toki Alley Tales (V)
TokiAlleyTalesV.description: Will this middle section filled with regret lead to a more interesting story thereafter?

PassPermit.name: Pass Permit
PassPermit.description: A pass permit you obtained from Yae Miko. With this, you can enter Tenshukaku without restrictions and meet the Raiden Shogun.\nYou heard that this was made for emergencies, but that Yae Miko seems to have never had a chance to use it.

DangoMilk.name: Dango Milk
DangoMilk.description: A creative snack made by adding sticky dango to milk. It is sweet and has a dense mouthfeel. All the customers who have tried it love it.\nStill, it is dango that's been added in — drink too much and you might lose your appetite.

RealmDispatch.name: Realm Dispatch
RealmDispatch.description: A realm dispatch that you obtained from Tubby. It seems to be able to allow your companions to come and go in your realm as they please...\nAfter acquiring this item, you can invite companions to reside in your Serenitea Pot from the Placement Screen.

ThunderSakuraCrab.name: Thunder Sakura Crab
ThunderSakuraCrab.description: A crab that lives beside the Thunder Sakura. One wonders if it has any unique properties...

FreshSeagrass.name: Fresh Seagrass
FreshSeagrass.description: Fresh Seagrass. It looks like it would make a good meal.

FreshSakuraBloom.name: Fresh Sakura Bloom
FreshSakuraBloom.description: A fresh sakura bloom. One can't be sure how Julie is going to use it in her dish...

FreshSnapdragon.name: Fresh Snapdragon
FreshSnapdragon.description: Fresh snapdragon. It should be most suitable for cooking.

FreshBirdEgg.name: Fresh Bird Egg
FreshBirdEgg.description: A fresh egg that should be most amenable to cooking.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsunePrologue.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune: Prologue
NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsunePrologue.description: Stories about memories are always closely intertwined with transience. This book is not all-new, but is an adaptation of "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune."

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneI.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (I)
NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneI.description: The story of the "Black Fox" Itaru was actually the third volume in the original "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune." It appears at the front of this edition due to the writer's personal preference.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneII.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (II)
NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneII.description: This volume recounts the clash between "Black Fox Itaru" and the "Twin Oni of Tokaku." This tale was missing from the original text, but it was fortunately rediscovered at a later date. It is presented here in an edited form.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneIII.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (III)
NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneIII.description: In the 500-year-old "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune," Youzan and Yui went on to have their own tales. But at this time, the mother-daughter pair are still reliant on Itaru to rescue them.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneIV.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (IV)
NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneIV.description: This is the tensest tale of the series, said to have been written by Urakusai upon his return from Liyue. It is featured in full in this writer's adaptation.

SangonomiyaChronicles.name: Sangonomiya Chronicles
SangonomiyaChronicles.description: Historical annals written by the famous Shogunate historian Kujou Michizane, who was known as one of the "The Three Kujou Dignitaries," or "The Great Calligrapher." It chronicles the history of Watatsumi Island in broad strokes.

TheSagaOfHamavaranPreface.name: The Saga of Hamavaran (Preface)
TheSagaOfHamavaranPreface.description: The prefaces of the new light novel "The Saga of Hamavaran," now combined into their own separate volume due to a business model adjustment!

TheSagaOfHamavaranI.name: The Saga of Hamavaran (I)
TheSagaOfHamavaranI.description: "How could this happen..." An ordinary scholar from Sumeru is unexpectedly assigned an unpopular specialization and ordered to go forth to the land of thunder and lightning... The curtains slowly rise on an adventure in the nation of many shores!

TheSagaOfHamavaranII.name: The Saga of Hamavaran (II)
TheSagaOfHamavaranII.description: "'Ghost-calling'? Is that the same as 'spirit-warding' back home?" With confusing questions swirling in his mind, Hamavaran begins to speak with his newfound traveling companion. An unexpected journey begins!

ALegendOfSwordI.name: A Legend of Sword (I)
ALegendOfSwordI.description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, light-centuries of war unfold down on the planet's surface... With this grandiose opening comes an all-new tale of gallantry!

ALegendOfSwordII.name: A Legend of Sword (II)
ALegendOfSwordII.description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, no battle is legendary enough to be any more than a ripple in the silence for those who dwell upon the shore... But for the warriors in the thick of it, the war is all there is.

ALegendOfSwordIII.name: A Legend of Sword (III)
ALegendOfSwordIII.description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse lies a small chain of shattered isles, each of which has its own history, featuring tales heroic and trivial alike. This heroic tale is set in the time of the Suruga Shogunate.

ALegendOfSwordIV.name: A Legend of Sword (IV)
ALegendOfSwordIV.description: There is a saying in Inazuma: "What are bandits but the children of war?" In times of tumult, even the harvest is a battlefield... See how this unfolds in the latest volume of "A Legend of Sword"!

ALegendOfSwordV.name: A Legend of Sword (V)
ALegendOfSwordV.description: Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, in nondescript village in a remote corner of the shattered isles, a ronin who has fallen upon hard times forms an alliance with a group of farmers. A great battle with the bandits draws near...

SacredSakuraCleansingSummary.name: Sacred Sakura Cleansing Summary
SacredSakuraCleansingSummary.description: A tattered scroll containing information related to the Sacred Sakura Cleansing Ritual. Some pages seem to bear the cinnabar seal of some shrine.

FreshMushroom.name: Fresh Mushroom
FreshMushroom.description: A mushroom that did not originally grow in this area, but began to grow with wild profusion after absorbing sufficient special nutrition.

CrabBait.name: Crab Bait
CrabBait.description: Crab bait that you got from Xudong. Laying it should attract crabs.

SomeonesDiaryVJinrenIsland.name: Someone's Diary V: Jinren Island
SomeonesDiaryVJinrenIsland.description: A diary left behind by someone in the wilderness that tells of the owner's unfortunate encounters at Jinren Island.

DiaryOfRoaldTheAdventurerRitou.name: Diary of Roald the Adventurer: Ritou
DiaryOfRoaldTheAdventurerRitou.description: A diary left behind by the famed adventurer, Roald. The pages bear both the refreshing scent of sakura flowers and the bitterness of tobacco leaves.

GrandNarukamiShrineOmamori.name: Grand Narukami Shrine Omamori
GrandNarukamiShrineOmamori.description: An omamori given to you by Yae Miko.\n"You can take this out and have a look whenever you think of me as well, you know?"

OfficialTenryouCommissionDocument.name: Official Tenryou Commission Document
OfficialTenryouCommissionDocument.description: Obtained from Kujou Takayuki. None are privy to these contents save him and the Shogun — or so they tell you. It has the seal of the Kujou Clan Head on it.

TenryouCommissionSecretLetter.name: Tenryou Commission Secret Letter
TenryouCommissionSecretLetter.description: Obtained from Kujou Takayuki. The contents are a bit ambiguous, but it isn't difficult to see that some of it involves an exchange of intelligence with the Fatui.

SupersizedFirework.name: Supersized Firework
SupersizedFirework.description: Yoimiya's pride and joy as the current owner of Naganohara Fireworks. It still seems to be in an experimental state. Nothing's going to go wrong... right?

SpecialMagicalCrystalOre.name: Special Magical Crystal Ore
SpecialMagicalCrystalOre.description: The Special Magical Crystal Ore mentioned in the sailing log. It looks exactly the same as normal magical crystal ore, so there must be some other key factor that allows it to attract the Lunar Leviathan.

OreSlag.name: Ore Slag
OreSlag.description: Slag left behind amidst some ore on Dragonspine. The valuable portions have been taken away, and the rest is just worthless, useless dross — or at least, that's how people might be inclined to see it. They would have carried it off as well otherwise, right?

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationI.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (I)
PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationI.description: The princess who was prophesied to bring destruction witnesses the imminent fall of her nation, and it is at this moment when a wandering warrior descends from the skies, ignorant of the truth.\nThe pair's journey amidst the fires of an ancient warring period are about to begin!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationII.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (II)
PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationII.description: "A princess who brings destruction. Hah. Isn't that just an excuse for making war?"\nThey travel to the center of the world in search of the truth behind the prophecy.\nThe super-popular romantic adventure continues!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationIII.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (III)
PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationIII.description: The two, who have entered the field of battle, finally witness the true Avici. The truth behind the fires of war that have swept across the world will be revealed here!\nThis volume comes with some super value-added extras!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationIV.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (IV)
PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationIV.description: "Go back to hell, you jumped-up vengeful spirit!"\nThe riveting flashback chapter! What lies within the warrior's buried past?\nHere comes a new chapter in the adventures of the princess who lost her nation and the warrior!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationV.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (V)
PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationV.description: "If this world requires your sacrifice to be saved, then it might as well burn."\nHaving reached the Sky Tower at the heart of the world at last, is this... finally the end of the pair's tale?

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationVI.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (VI)
PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationVI.description: The truth of the world is revealed — and what a terrible joke it is! Even when separated, the two cannot escape the chains of fate.\nThis may be the final volume of "Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation," but our story isn't over yet!

FlowersForPrincessFischl.name: Flowers for Princess Fischl (0)
FlowersForPrincessFischl.description: The preliminary volume of the "Flowers for Princess Fischl" series.\nThis work originally came in a violet and black wooden box as a limited edition gift, but many hardcore fans of the series who wanted to collect the whole saga were enraged by the great amount of content versus the small number of copies printed.\nDue to this, Yae Publishing House would name this book "Volume 0" and sell it separately. Eventually, the original work, the boxed collector's edition, and Volume 0 would all come to be regarded as standard by fans.

TeyvatTravelGuideInazuma.name: Teyvat Travel Guide - Inazuma
TeyvatTravelGuideInazuma.description: A magazine by the Adventurers' Guild. Each issue introduces great sceneries across Teyvat. This issue includes a short traveling diary of Alice the Traveler in Inazuma.

DriftingBottleWithLetter.name: Drifting Bottle With Letter
DriftingBottleWithLetter.description: A floating bottle that you fished up accidentally. The cork on this bottle has already been damaged, and the letter within has been mildewed. Thankfully, you discovered it in time, or its contents may have become lost to time altogether.

Onibudou.name: Onibudou
Onibudou.description: A standalone volume from the light novel series "Onibudou," written by Junkichi, a writer with Yae Publishing House. This collection contains the first two major arcs in the story. The quality of the serialized version varies quite a bit, but it still enjoys a degree of popularity amongst readers.

LuckyOmamori.name: Lucky Omamori
LuckyOmamori.description: An omamori that Thoma gave you. It is said to be able to bring good luck.

BoxOfNails.name: Box of Nails
BoxOfNails.description: A box of nails obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use it for repairs.

Planks.name: Planks
Planks.description: Wooden planks obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use them for repairs.

Rope.name: Rope
Rope.description: Rope obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use it for repairs.

KitosSachet.name: Kito's Sachet
KitosSachet.description: A sachet carried by Kito and Kina. It seems to have been woven from two smaller sachets before being carefully hidden in a wooden box.

TreasureMapFragment.name: Treasure Map Fragment
TreasureMapFragment.description: A treasure map fragment left behind by Shitoki's brother. The vellum made from animal hide has the faint scent of sea-salt on it.

ATreasureMapLeftForShitoki.name: A Treasure Map Left for Shitoki
ATreasureMapLeftForShitoki.description: A complete Treasure Map made from several fragments. It gives off a faint sea-salt scent.

MakirisCharm.name: Makiri's Charm
MakirisCharm.description: A sturdy bag that seems seawater-proof. It's full of blessing from the ancestral spirits.

GeneralPurposeDirectionalConductionCompo.name: General Purpose Directional Conduction Component
GeneralPurposeDirectionalConductionCompo.description: A basic, common component often found in various creations of an ancient civilization, the function of which seems to be ensuring that these creations continue operating. Due to their close similarity in makeup to the components used in Pursina's Spikes, they can be used to replace its damaged parts. To think that Pursina's Spikes need such priceless objects to repair them... What a terrifyingly high-maintenance device.

HeavyKey.name: Heavy Key
HeavyKey.description: A key that feels heavy in your hand. What door will it open?

IntactKey.name: Intact Key
IntactKey.description: A key that at least looks intact. One wonders who might have left it here...

SumidasLetter.name: Sumida's Letter
SumidasLetter.description: A letter given to you by Sumida.\nGive this letter to Kama in Ritou.

NewFireworkModel.name: New Firework Model
NewFireworkModel.description: Yoimiya's new firework model. Who knows what it will do...

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneV.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (V)
NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneV.description: Commentary regarding ancient matters that was specially added to the "New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune." If you find it an insipid, monotonous slog, dear reader, you may skip this volume. But as far as the author is concerned, this is one waste of words and emotion that cannot be avoided.

NorthlandBankCheck.name: Northland Bank Check
NorthlandBankCheck.description: A check with the emblem of the Northland Bank printed on it. It can be exchanged for Mora.

ScrawledTreasureMap.name: Scrawled Treasure Map
ScrawledTreasureMap.description: This is an awful specimen of a treasure map. Its lines are random and its grids scrawled. You could probably sell this for a significant amount of Mora by claiming that it is the work of some stream-of-consciousness artist, though.

KiminamiAnnasInvigoratingKittyMeal.name: Kiminami Anna's Invigorating Kitty Meal
KiminamiAnnasInvigoratingKittyMeal.description: An Invigorating Kitty Meal made personally by Kiminami Anna. You're not certain if Neko will like it or not...

AutakeSlate.name: Autake Slate
AutakeSlate.description: An example of the Ishine Script that was once used on Tsurumi Island.\nIt probably needs to be returned to some place in the Autake Plains.

APreliminaryStudyOfSangonomiyaFolkBelief.name: A Preliminary Study of Sangonomiya Folk Belief
APreliminaryStudyOfSangonomiyaFolkBelief.description: This paper was written by Shihab Purbiruni, a scholar of modern history from Sumeru, two years before the civil war in Inazuma. It details the folk beliefs of Watatsumi Island and the Sangonomiya people, and puts forward some relatively new academic propositions.

TheLifeOfMouunTheShrineMaiden.name: The Life of Mouun the Shrine Maiden
TheLifeOfMouunTheShrineMaiden.description: For the people of Watatsumi, the legends of the Archon War are always filled with bitterness. Many of these millennia-old folksongs tell of a shrine maiden by the name of Mouun, who once rode upon the back of a sea monster, following the Great Serpent unto a tragic, moving end.

DebatesOnTheViceroyOfTheEast.name: Debates on the "Viceroy of the East"
DebatesOnTheViceroyOfTheEast.description: The "Viceroy of the East," or "Touzannou" sung of in Watatsumi folk tradition is also known as the "Akuou" all across Raiden's domains. He was the first vassal ruler of the Great Serpent Orobashi, and he was also the last.

TreasuredTalesOfTheChoukenShinkageuchiI.name: Treasured Tales of the Chouken Shinkageuchi (I)
TreasuredTalesOfTheChoukenShinkageuchiI.description: The first part of a traditional Inazuman novel. This particular volume is also known as "Shinkageuchi," and was once a restricted text. It contains a fantastical tale about the first Raiden Shogun and her kagemusha, depicting the benevolent sagacity of the first Shogun and the great valor of her kagemusha. However, due to the great popularity of another book known colloquially as "Raiden Reincarnation," many people became interested in stories of this kind. This book thus wound up being published in a haphazard manner.

MysteriousStone.name: Mysterious Stone
MysteriousStone.description: This object seems to carry the Ishine Script that was once used on Tsurumi Island.\nBring this stone back to its rightful place.

DiaryOfRoaldTheAdventurerTsurumiIsland.name: Diary of Roald the Adventurer: Tsurumi Island
DiaryOfRoaldTheAdventurerTsurumiIsland.description: A diary left behind by the famed adventurer, Roald. The pages bear both the moist smell of the fog and a certain fungal scent.

FreshMeat.name: Fresh Meat
FreshMeat.description: Food that Thoma has prepared for the stray cats and dogs. This should go like hotcakes.

BagOfRetrievedItems.name: Bag of Retrieved Items
BagOfRetrievedItems.description: A batch of abandoned goods that you found at a warehouse at the south wharf. They essentially have no value.

RepairedComb.name: Repaired Comb
RepairedComb.description: The comb that Ningguang commissioned Mingxing Jewelry to repair. It belongs to a special informant. The damage to the comb was originally quite severe. The fact that it could be repaired to this extent is quite impressive indeed.

MysteriousFlyer.name: Mysterious Flyer
MysteriousFlyer.description: A pamphlet you obtained from the Ms. Hina Fan Club. You've got to say that the design looks kind of familiar...

RigorousSchedule.name: Rigorous Schedule
RigorousSchedule.description: A schedule that you created for Ningguang. The various items are all laid out in a clear and easy-to-read manner.

SimpleSchedule.name: Simple Schedule
SimpleSchedule.description: A schedule that you created for Ningguang. Simple, cogent, and to the point.

StarsplinterIron.name: Starsplinter Iron
StarsplinterIron.description: One of the ores required to create Wonder Cores. It has the power to resonate with Visions.

Subrosium.name: Subrosium
Subrosium.description: One of the ores required to create Wonder Cores. It can often be found where dawn meets dusk.

WonderCore.name: Wonder Core
WonderCore.description: The core component to the Jade Chamber's mechanisms. When combined with Adepti Sigils, they can be used as the control center of the Jade Chamber.

AdeptiSigil.name: Adepti Sigil
AdeptiSigil.description: Adepti Sigils made by Shenhe. They contain dense adeptal energy.

RecordsOfAChangingVillage.name: Records of a Changing Village
RecordsOfAChangingVillage.description: Documents announcing the villagers' migration. It states that the village was forced to relocate due to a god's remains.

MountainousMiscellany.name: Mountainous Miscellany
MountainousMiscellany.description: This text contains all manner of strange legends about Mt. Tianheng's stones, including tales about many rare ores. It is said that if you stand in the middle of the lake south of Mt. Tianheng at dusk, you will find the legendary Subrosium.

NeatlyWrittenNote.name: Neatly-Written Note
NeatlyWrittenNote.description: The paper of this letter is slightly brittle and its ink is also a little smudged. It seems that both it and its owner have borne the assault of the waves. Unfortunately, while they encountered the same tribulations, they did not share the same fate.

LittleMengsDriftingBottle.name: Little Meng's Drifting Bottle
LittleMengsDriftingBottle.description: A bottle containing Little Meng's various troubles. You wonder what's inside...

Lumenstone.name: Lumenstone
Lumenstone.description: A special stone mined from the depths of The Chasm. It is said that it has catalytic properties.\nIt almost blazes with light in the gloomy mines, but it loses all such effects the moment one leaves The Chasm.\nIt seems to have other unique properties as well that have yet to be discovered.

MuningsNote.name: Muning's Note
MuningsNote.description: The Ministry representative Muning gave you this note. Despite its short length, the word "prohibited" appears 8 times. If you give this to an adventurer named Zhiqiong, you will receive the aid you need.

TreasureHoardersTreasureMap.name: Treasure Hoarders' Treasure Map
TreasureHoardersTreasureMap.description: This treasure map, once torn in two and kept in different hiding spots by the Treasure Hoarders, is now whole again.\nIf you follow the symbol on it, you might discover some special treasure!

StorehouseSecurityKeyNo.name: Storehouse Security Key No. 1
StorehouseSecurityKeyNo.description: A key to a certain storehouse that was hidden in a very obvious place, yet was never found by the Treasure Hoarders. Guess they're not as good at their job as they think, huh?

ASetOfCannonballs.name: A Set of Cannonballs
ASetOfCannonballs.description: Cannonballs for the Mountainator, also known as the Safe Blasting Mechanism 2156. Although you used the Lumenstone Adjuvant to clear the unknown pollutants away, there is still a stench about them that can be detected even while covering your nose.\nUgh. Do you really have to touch it?

SpecialUnmovingEssentialOil.name: Special Unmoving Essential Oil
SpecialUnmovingEssentialOil.description: A dangerous substance made using the formula that Clitopho provided by compressing two Unmoving Essential Oils into one very dense bottle filled with Geo elemental energy.\nDue to its fame as a highly unstable concoction, only madmen or experienced miners would dare use it, making it an uncommon sight indeed.\nHandle with utmost care!

KeyToAStonyHall.name: Key to a Stony Hall
KeyToAStonyHall.description: According to Khedive's initial speculations, this construct may be a "key" that could open the door to some ruin somewhere.

PhotoOfAStrangeRock.name: Photo of a Strange Rock
PhotoOfAStrangeRock.description: You took this picture of a strange rock that can be seen on the walls of The Chasm. You do not know what the patterns on the rock mean, but perhaps it could be of value to some researchers.

AkademiyaRecommendationLetter.name: Akademiya Recommendation Letter
AkademiyaRecommendationLetter.description: This letter, carefully crafted, and it is sealed in the name of "Ecologist Khedive Pursina."\nYou got this as a gift from Khedive. He claims that this is even more precious than gold, and can gain you the help of the House of Purbiruni.\nKhedive himself believes monetary remuneration to be something of an insult... Hopefully, this doesn't prove to be a trend with people from Sumeru.

OrbOfTheBlueDepths.name: Orb of the Blue Depths
OrbOfTheBlueDepths.description: A strange gem left behind by a foe from the Abyss. If you look into it hard, it is almost as if you are looking into a long-borne dream shrouded by a deep fog.

MinersKey.name: Miner's Key
MinersKey.description: Such keys are commonly found in the mines, but one wonders why it would appear here.

BlessingsOfWisdom.name: Blessings of Wisdom
BlessingsOfWisdom.description: A suspicious object you obtained from Xamaran. It is claimed that this can clear the source of the foul energy. Condensed from the fungus' absorbed nutrients, the agglomeration of spores... and a thick sense of humor.

MountainatorCannonballFuseAttached.name: Mountainator Cannonball (Fuse Attached)
MountainatorCannonballFuseAttached.description: A cannonball with a fuse carefully attached. Ready to be fired at any time!

ToyDoll.name: Toy Doll
ToyDoll.description: A toy belonging to miner Qi Ding's daughter. It looks pretty tattered and it's hard to imagine that any kid would like it. But the intricate stitch-work shows that this was once quite the pricey item.

FlowerOfFarsight.name: Flower of Farsight
FlowerOfFarsight.description: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm... possibly? It seems just like an ordinary Qingxin, and one that has newly sprouted as well, seeing as how its white petals have never been touched by dew.\nWho knows how many people have once climbed up to high heights to pick one such fresh flower? Who knows if these flowers eventually bore witness to partings or reunions?

Skyfeather.name: Skyfeather
Skyfeather.description: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm, a feather that fell from an eagle that flew over the top of the cavern. The Millelith seem to enjoy collecting these tough feathers to use as ornaments.\nIt is said that eagle feathers fit valiant warriors best, and so tend to be used to decorate the armor and arms of the bravest, such that they might break the enemy formation with all the swiftness of that great bird of prey.

SundialOfAges.name: Sundial of Ages
SundialOfAges.description: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It seems quite old now, but the etchings are still very clear, and so it can still be used.\nThe sun is a rare sight down in The Chasm, and it is easy to lose track of time. But someday, this sundial will once again track the passage of years.

CupOfCommons.name: Cup of Commons
CupOfCommons.description: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. Neither stone nor gem, it somehow still became part of the Treasure Hoarders' loot hoard.\nIt has been filled by turns with fine wine, fair treasure, and blood. Now, its previous shame has been washed away, and it is ready to take on new memories.

HelmOfWarding.name: Helm of Warding
HelmOfWarding.description: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It was found hidden in the living quarters of the miners. A slightly less discerning eye might have mistaken it for a miner's hat.\nIt is heavily scarred and pitted, making one wonder how many miners' lives it must have saved.

WarriorsSpear.name: Warrior's Spear
WarriorsSpear.description: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It was lost amid the ancient battlefield five hundred years ago. The long years have worn the edge of the spear-point away, but it still looks quite ominous nonetheless.\nOne can imagine that it was once wielded by a warrior most brave, earning the cheers of the young wherever it swept, even unto The Chasm itself.

BrassRing.name: Brass Ring
BrassRing.description: A ring that you got off a Golden Weasel Thief. See how it glitters, see how it shines! The Weasel Thief must have planned on using it to attract a mate, and it does indeed look quite valuable. One imagines that its owner must be quite distressed at the moment.

ShriveledSeed.name: Shriveled Seed
ShriveledSeed.description: A seemingly withered object that seems to, by normal judgment, be a seed. However, it still has a surprising amount of life in it yet.\nBest not to eat it for now...

LumenstoneOre.name: Lumenstone Ore
LumenstoneOre.description: The raw ore from which Lumenstone may be found. If processed properly, it can be used to strengthen the Lumenstone Adjuvant you have. Why not hit Jinwu up and ask her?

YueChuansDriftingBottle.name: Yue Chuan's Drifting Bottle
YueChuansDriftingBottle.description: A drifting bottle that contains Yue Chuan's reply to Little Meng. You wonder if it'll reach him...

HiraizumisGoods.name: Hiraizumi's Goods
HiraizumisGoods.description: Fresh soy milk. It'll go bad quick if improperly stored.

CellKey.name: Cell Key
CellKey.description: A metal key that you obtained from the Fatui. It should be able to open some kind of door.

FreshlyPickedCallaLily.name: Freshly-Picked Calla Lily
FreshlyPickedCallaLily.description: A freshly-picked Calla Lily. Suitable for being used as a specimen.

FreshlyPickedSmallLampGrass.name: Freshly-Picked Small Lamp Grass
FreshlyPickedSmallLampGrass.description: A freshly-picked Small Lamp Grass. Suitable for being used as a specimen.

FreshlyPickedCecilia.name: Freshly-Picked Cecilia
FreshlyPickedCecilia.description: A freshly-picked Cecilia with a pleasant fragrance.

RuinMachineCore.name: Ruin Machine Core
RuinMachineCore.description: The core section of a Ruin Guard. Old and new versions of this device are incompatible, and it thus cannot be used to empower other objects. However, the leftover energy should be enough to power one Ruin Guard.

DatesKey.name: Date's Key
DatesKey.description: Date's key. Unfortunately, this will not open the treasury of a distinguished Enkanomiya family. It will only open the way to the Heterodoxa labyrinth.

PileOfLavenderMelons.name: Pile of Lavender Melons
PileOfLavenderMelons.description: This pile of Lavender Melons may have been collected and placed here by some kind of animal. They look a bit like Onikabuto from a distance.

FineIncense.name: Fine Incense
FineIncense.description: Incense you got from Wang Ping'an. Looks to be of good quality.

CuriousCube.name: Curious Cube
CuriousCube.description: An unknown construct that you discovered in the depths of The Chasm. It resembles an intricately-made cube.

ANoteSomeoneStuffedYou.name: A Note Someone Stuffed You
ANoteSomeoneStuffedYou.description: As you were walking down the streets of Inazuma, someone stuffed this note onto your person. Two strange symbols are drawn on it.

SpecialBambooSlip.name: Special Bamboo Slip
SpecialBambooSlip.description: A Bamboo Slip upon which Momoyo has applied some specially made elemental powder. Store and handle it with care! The powder has some measure of poison in it — and of course, you'll get yelled at for improper handling.

FinalInstructions.name: "Final Instructions"
FinalInstructions.description: Fatui operational orders that you obtained from Lyudochka. They detail an operation that will take place in the future on Watatsumi Island. This intelligence is very important — peoples' lives are at stake here!

BagOfClothes.name: Bag of Clothes
BagOfClothes.description: A bag that contains Lyudochka's Fatui uniform. Considering the controversial nature of Fatui uniforms, it is best not to let other people see this.

SpecialFortuneSlip.name: Special Fortune Slip
SpecialFortuneSlip.description: A specially made fortune slip that describes how your luck will be like today. There is nothing different about this Fortune Slip, save for the fact that you got it for the fake Bamboo Slip.\nWhose fortune does this Fortune Slip describe?

StrangeObject.name: Strange Object
StrangeObject.description: A strange item that you fished up from the underground waterways in The Chasm. It's wet, and you cannot tell if this is a living or dead thing.

BedrockKeyLocationDiagram.name: Bedrock Key Location Diagram
BedrockKeyLocationDiagram.description: A simple diagram that Zhiqiong drew in haste. It indicates the general locations of several Bedrock Keys.

LightMoraPurse.name: Light Mora Purse
LightMoraPurse.description: A Mora purse you found in a treasure chest. The feeling you had when weighing it was one of immense disappointment.

FullMoraPurse.name: Full Mora Purse
FullMoraPurse.description: A Mora purse you found in a treasure chest. Compared to the previous purse you found, this one provides a decent amount more comfort.

PlumpFish.name: Plump Fish
PlumpFish.description: A fish you just obtained from the river. It might be considered a gift from nature. It is so excellent that it only needs to be grilled a little to be delicious as can be.

YunJinsPersonalLetter.name: Yun Jin's Personal Letter
YunJinsPersonalLetter.description: A letter that Yun Jin personally wrote to Shiyun. It seems to hold the key to turning the situation around.

LyudochkasLetter.name: Lyudochka's Letter
LyudochkasLetter.description: The letter that Lyudochka asked someone from Yae Publishing House to pass on to you. It contains her reasons for leaving without saying why. However, whether you will accept her reasons for departing or not is a different story.\nIt was you who discovered her presence and changed her fate... Might you be able to do still more to change this ending for the better?

LyudochkasMoraPurse.name: Lyudochka's Mora Purse
LyudochkasMoraPurse.description: The Mora purse that Lyudochka left behind. It contains a decent sum of Mora, but even Paimon doesn't want to use it.

FatuiCodeSheet.name: Fatui Code Sheet
FatuiCodeSheet.description: A certain ever-somnolent member of the Shuumatsuban wrote this Fatui Code Sheet.\nReading it does not merely let you know that "these Fatui speak very oddly indeed" — you can also feel the recorder's intense lethargy penetrating the paper in the form of saliva.

LightPurse.name: Light Purse
LightPurse.description: A purse you got from Mona. It contains the amount she needs to pay her rent.

MarjoriesGift.name: Marjorie's Gift
MarjoriesGift.description: A present that you got from Marjorie. You've heard that children will like it...

ViktorsGift.name: Viktor's Gift
ViktorsGift.description: A gift you got from Viktor. He seems to have also put a letter under the gift box.

FreshWolfhooks.name: Fresh Wolfhooks
FreshWolfhooks.description: Fresh Wolfhooks that Schuster picked. Thankfully, they haven't been damaged by monsters yet.

LyudochkasFortuneSlip.name: Lyudochka's Fortune Slip
LyudochkasFortuneSlip.description: A specially made fortune slip that describes how your luck will be like today. There is nothing different about this Fortune Slip, save for the fact that you used it to open Lyudochka's heart.\nNow, this Fortune Slip has returned to your hands, along with her heartfelt blessings. If you've got the time, why not go to the Grand Narukami Shrine to see her?

TheMiraculousAdventuresOfTheTraveler.name: The Miraculous Adventures of the Traveler
TheMiraculousAdventuresOfTheTraveler.description: "This is a rather orthodox light novel, with its contents essentially being an edited version of real life in Teyvat. What is surprising, however, is that the author seems to be highly knowledgeable about Watatsumi Island, with many vivid, almost lifelike descriptions." — Ms. Hina

FrostglazeCrystal.name: Frostglaze Crystal
FrostglazeCrystal.description:
A glaze crystal produced in the depths of The Chasm, this special Glaze Sand Crystal ore was one of many scattered about during the battle against the giant ruin machine. Glaze Sand Crystal ore is a regional specialty of The Chasm, but this one is different from the rest.
Under the radiance of the blue crystal and the power of the Abyss, a strange spiral pattern has emerged within this stone, and it is cold, almost chilling to the touch.
This once smooth crystal has been transformed into this shape by the great might that descended from the heavens and the miasma that arose from the earth's depths — and perhaps the form it has taken is itself a warning unto mortals.
If the interaction of these forces alone could twist stone and metal thus, if that ordinary heroine was truly able to witness the end of the pitch-dark path, how would she have faced the discovery she would make?

LightRealmSigil.name: Light Realm Sigil
LightRealmSigil.description: A mark symbolizing the recognition of Enkanomiya's Tokoyo Ookami.\nThey can be offered up to the Statue of the Vassals of Watatsumi, thus upgrading the Bokuso Box.

LightRealmCore.name: Light Realm Core
LightRealmCore.description: You discovered this mysterious stone while exploring the darkened realm of Enkanomiya.\nThe Light Realm gave humans additional means to resist the Abyss.

BloodiedSergeantsInsignia.name: Bloodied Sergeant's Insignia
BloodiedSergeantsInsignia.description: The bloodied and muddied insignia of a Fatui sergeant. You have no idea how it ended up in the depths of The Chasm.

CorporalNikolaysDiary.name: Corporal Nikolay's Diary
CorporalNikolaysDiary.description: A letter left behind by Corporal Nikolay. Its contents have long ceased to be whole.

MoraPurse.name: Mora Purse
MoraPurse.description: You were asked by Xu from Feiyun Commerce Guild to deliver this to Huishan Hall's representative Muning, who is at The Chasm. It contains a rather sizable sum of Mora.

AFirsthandGuideToSummoningSpirits.name: A Firsthand Guide to Summoning Spirits
AFirsthandGuideToSummoningSpirits.description: A light novel that has been popular in Inazuma lately. It contains all manner of bizarre tales involving ancient youkai.

DreamSakura.name: Dream Sakura
DreamSakura.description:
You held a single sakura petal in your hand before leaving Raiden Makoto's realm of consciousness.
Its existence is a mystery. It appears no different from ordinary sakura pedals, and there it silently sits in your storage just like any of the others. But you can no longer touch it, nor can you feel its weight or warmth. When an object loses any of the attributes that one would normally ascribe to it, how can its "existence" be proven for sure?
As you think back on the many sights the petal must have witnessed in the past, a certain guess comes to mind: that which sustains this sakura petal's existence must be someone's will. But as to who this person is, and whether they are intentionally or unintentionally keeping this petal in existence, neither can be known. Nor can you prove whether that willpower is one derived from yearning, trust, or gratitude.
Perhaps, when "that person's will" changes, so too will this sakura petal disappear.
Just to be safe, it might be best to check back from time to time and see if it still exists.

AphotiumOre.name: Aphotium Ore
AphotiumOre.description: A special ore created due to the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri. As Enkanomiya's environment has undergone extreme changes, the memories and thoughts of Watatsumi Omikami scattered throughout Enkanomiya have coalesced into medullae, which then transformed into ore.

TokoyoLegume.name: Tokoyo Legume
TokoyoLegume.description: A special plant that was produced via the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri. With the awakening of the Sangacorexes, the elemental energies within Enkanomiya have been pacified. This is a naturally-growing fertilizing crop that will turn into loam within the soil once it decays.

HuskGem.name: Husk Gem
HuskGem.description: A jewel that fell from the armor of a special Shadowy Husk after you defeated it. You can feel a will surging within it. Perhaps it might be more correct to say that this will manifested itself through the armor rather than manipulated it.

FragmentedAccessory.name: Fragmented Accessory
FragmentedAccessory.description: A small accessory you got from Kokomi. It seems to be the fragment of another object. According to her, it might come in handy at some point.

TsumisMap.name: Tsumi's Map
TsumisMap.description: A map drawn by Tsumi. There are some markings on it.

HakuenMichimitsuAmenoma.name: Hakuen Michimitsu Amenoma
HakuenMichimitsuAmenoma.description: The heirloom blade of the Iwakura Clan.\nAlthough the one who forged this blade possessed great skills, and though it is true that this sword has slain many a foe, it does not possess any special powers. Nor has the Iwakura Succession ever obtained a Vision. Their excellent swordsmanship was purely a result of their honing of mind, body, and technique.\nThis blade has been submerged in water for a long time and seems to have completely rusted.

WoodenCageKey.name: Wooden Cage Key
WoodenCageKey.description: Someone from the Kanjou Commission left this behind. You should be able to use this to rescue Shinnojou.

DamagedStoneSlate.name: Damaged Stone Slate
DamagedStoneSlate.description: A seemingly ordinary stone slate. Who knows what secrets it might hold...

MysteriousStoneSlate.name: Mysterious Stone Slate
MysteriousStoneSlate.description: The final stone slate you obtained. Secrets within secrets, eh?

YanbosNote.name: Yanbo's Note
YanbosNote.description: A somewhat complete note, written in a neat hand. It seems to have been a letter left for an old friend.

NikolaysLetter.name: Nikolay's Letter
NikolaysLetter.description: A letter you found off one of the Black Serpent Knights. The name of the letter's recipient is neatly written: "Katarina Snezhevna, My Dear Elder Sister," while the sender's name is written somewhat haphazardly, though you can make out the words "Your Brother, Nikolay Snezhevich."

FragrantSeasoning.name: Fragrant Seasoning
FragrantSeasoning.description: Seasoning created using the recipe given to you by Nazafarin. It has a tangy aroma and serves to bring out the flavor in any dish it is added to.

FragrantVegetarianAbalone.name: Fragrant Vegetarian Abalone
FragrantVegetarianAbalone.description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

TheAlmightyAratakiGreatAndGloriousDrumal.name: The Almighty Arataki Great and Glorious Drumalong Festival!
TheAlmightyAratakiGreatAndGloriousDrumal.description: This is a most lavish invitation letter, whether in its construction or its content. The letter describes a large-scale, deep-rooted, nationally-acclaimed event in which you shall be a most important guest, the radiant star of the show.

WorksiteRecords.name: Worksite Records
WorksiteRecords.description: This was originally a ledger, but appears to have been re-purposed as a site log instead. The latest daily happenings at The Chasm have been scribbled into its pages, though not much of this information is of any particular use.

FragrantMintSalad.name: Fragrant Mint Salad
FragrantMintSalad.description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

FragrantTripleLayeredConsomm.name: Fragrant Triple-Layered Consommé
FragrantTripleLayeredConsomm.description: A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

ZhiqiongsLetter.name: Zhiqiong's Letter
ZhiqiongsLetter.description: A letter left by a young adventurer. There is a slightly bitter scent of Qingxin on this piece of paper.

ArrivalSchedule.name: Arrival Schedule
